"><subfield code="a">"This amendment is part of the POSIX series of standards for applications and user interfaces to open systems. The purpose of this project is to specify a set of interfaces to allow portable access to underlying trace management services by application programs. These underlying services provide access to streams of event data, where the events can be generated by software and/or hardware, either from the application or the operating system. This standard is stated in terms of its C language binding."</subfield></datafield><datafield tag="530" ind1=" " ind2=" "><subfield code="a">Also available via the World Wide Web with additional all_text_timv: IEEE standard for information technology -- Portable operating system interface (POSIX). Part 1: System application program interface (API). Amendment 6: Tracing [C language] / sponsor, Portable Application Standards Committee of the IEEE Computer Society. Portable operating system interface (POSIX) System application program interface (API) IEEE Std 1003.1q-2000 New York : Institute of Electrical and Electronics Engineers, ©2001. ix, 109 pages ; 28 cm. text txt rdacontent unmediated n rdamedia volume nc rdacarrier IEEE standards "IEEE Std 1003.1q-2000 (Amendment to IEEE Std 1003.1, 1996 edition)." "Approved 21 September 2000, IEEE-SA Standards Board." Includes bibliographical references and indexes. "This amendment is part of the POSIX series of standards for applications and user interfaces to open systems. The purpose of this project is to specify a set of interfaces to allow portable access to underlying trace management services by application programs. These underlying services provide access to streams of event data, where the events can be generated by software and/or hardware, either from the application or the operating system. This standard is stated in terms of its C language binding." Also available via the World Wide Web with additional title: IEEE Std 1003.1q-2000. notes_summary_ssim: "This amendment is part of the POSIX series of standards for applications and user interfaces to open systems. The purpose of this project is to specify a set of interfaces to allow portable access to underlying trace management services by application programs. These underlying services provide access to streams of event data, where the events can be generated by software and/or hardware, either from the application or the operating system. This standard is stated in terms of its C language binding."
other_forms_ssm: Also available via the World Wide Web with additional title: IEEE Std 1003.1q-2000.
